channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Penalised regression with multiple sources of prior effects
item.description: In many high-dimensional prediction or classification tasks, complementary data on the features are available, e. g. prior biological knowledge on (epi)genetic markers.

item.title: Simulating Road Spray Effects in Automotive Lidar Sensor Models
item.description: The model conforms to the Open Simulation Interface (OSI) standard and is based on the formation of detection clusters within a spray plume.

item.title: BLASER: A Text-Free Speech-to-Speech Translation Evaluation Metric
item.description: In this paper, we propose a text-free evaluation metric for end-to-end S2ST, named BLASER, to avoid the dependency on ASR systems.

item.title: Fast Learning of Dynamic Hand Gesture Recognition with Few-Shot Learning Models
item.description: Savings were defined as the number of additional observations required when a Deep Learning model is trained on new hand gestures instead of a Few Shot Learning model.

item.title: Uniform Sequence Better: Time Interval Aware Data Augmentation for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: However, we observe that the time interval in a sequence may vary significantly different, and thus result in the ineffectiveness of user modeling due to the issue of \emph{preference drift}.

item.title: Azimuth: Systematic Error Analysis for Text Classification
item.description: Compared to other stages of the ML development cycle, such as model training and hyper-parameter tuning, the process and tooling for the error analysis stage are less mature.

item.title: POTATO: The Portable Text Annotation Tool
item.description: We present POTATO, the Portable text annotation tool, a free, fully open-sourced annotation system that 1) supports labeling many types of text and multimodal data; 2) offers easy-to-configure features to maximize the productivity of both deployers and annotators (convenient templates for common ML/NLP tasks, active learning, keypress shortcuts, keyword highlights, tooltips); and 3) supports a high degree of customization (editable UI, inserting pre-screening questions, attention and qualification tests).

item.title: ReCo: Reliable Causal Chain Reasoning via Structural Causal Recurrent Neural Networks
item.description: Causal chain reasoning (CCR) is an essential ability for many decision-making AI systems, which requires the model to build reliable causal chains by connecting causal pairs.

item.title: From Xception to NEXcepTion: New Design Decisions and Neural Architecture Search
item.description: In this paper, we present a modified Xception architecture, the NEXcepTion network.

item.title: How to disagree well: Investigating the dispute tactics used on Wikipedia
item.description: Disagreements are frequently studied from the perspective of either detecting toxicity or analysing argument structure.

item.title: Efficient Conditionally Invariant Representation Learning
item.description: The procedure requires just a single ridge regression from $Y$ to kernelized features of $Z$, which can be done in advance.

item.title: LEDCNet: A Lightweight and Efficient Semantic Segmentation Algorithm Using Dual Context Module for Extracting Ground Objects from UAV Aerial Remote Sensing Images
item.description: In order to make the model lightweight and improve a certain accuracy, this research developed a new lightweight and efficient network for the extraction of ground features from UAV aerial remote sensing images, called LDMCNet.

item.title: One-Stage Cascade Refinement Networks for Infrared Small Target Detection
item.description: Finally, we present a new research benchmark for infrared small target detection, consisting of the SIRST-V2 dataset of real-world, high-resolution single-frame targets, the normalized contrast evaluation metric, and the DeepInfrared toolkit for detection.

item.title: Convolution-enhanced Evolving Attention Networks
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first work that explicitly models the layer-wise evolution of attention maps.

item.title: Free-form 3D Scene Inpainting with Dual-stream GAN
item.description: Thus, we present a novel task named free-form 3D scene inpainting.

item.title: Robust Explanation Constraints for Neural Networks
item.description: Post-hoc explanation methods are used with the intent of providing insights about neural networks and are sometimes said to help engender trust in their outputs.

item.title: Homonymy Information for English WordNet
item.description: The outcome of our work is a high-quality homonymy annotation layer for Princeton WordNet, which we release.

item.title: An ensemble neural network approach to forecast Dengue outbreak based on climatic condition
item.description: In comparison with statistical, machine learning, and deep learning methods, our proposed XEWNet performs better in 75% of the cases for short-term and long-term forecasting of dengue incidence.

item.title: Unifying Human Motion Synthesis and Style Transfer with Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: To achieve high-quality results, we design a multi-task architecture of diffusion model that strategically generates aspects of human motions for local guidance.

item.title: An estimator for the recombination rate from a continuously observed diffusion of haplotype frequencies
item.description: Estimators for the recombination rate, which are usually based on the idea of integrating over the unobserved possible evolutionary histories of a sample, can therefore be noisy.

item.title: Injecting Domain Knowledge in Language Models for Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems
item.description: Pre-trained language models (PLM) have advanced the state-of-the-art across NLP applications, but lack domain-specific knowledge that does not naturally occur in pre-training data.

item.title: NeRF-Art: Text-Driven Neural Radiance Fields Stylization
item.description: As a powerful representation of 3D scenes, the neural radiance field (NeRF) enables high-quality novel view synthesis from multi-view images.

item.title: MM-SHAP: A Performance-agnostic Metric for Measuring Multimodal Contributions in Vision and Language Models & Tasks
item.description: But how to quantify the amount of unimodal collapse reliably, at dataset and instance-level, to diagnose and combat unimodal collapse in a targeted way?

item.title: Bayesian posterior approximation with stochastic ensembles
item.description: We introduce ensembles of stochastic neural networks to approximate the Bayesian posterior, combining stochastic methods such as dropout with deep ensembles.

item.title: Revisiting the Gold Standard: Grounding Summarization Evaluation with Robust Human Evaluation
item.description: 4) We evaluate existing automatic metrics using the collected human annotations across evaluation protocols and demonstrate how our benchmark leads to more statistically stable and significant results.

item.title: Two-stage Contextual Transformer-based Convolutional Neural Network for Airway Extraction from CT Images
item.description: In the first stage, the total airway mask and CT images are provided to the subnetwork, and the intrapulmonary airway mask and corresponding CT scans to the subnetwork in the second stage.

item.title: Bridging POMDPs and Bayesian decision making for robust maintenance planning under model uncertainty: An application to railway systems
item.description: We present a framework to estimate POMDP transition and observation model parameters directly from available data, via Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampling of a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) conditioned on actions.

item.title: Memory-like Adaptive Modeling Multi-Agent Learning System
item.description: In this work, we propose a self-supervised multi-agent system, termed a memory-like adaptive modeling multi-agent learning system (MAMMALS), that realizes online learning towards behavioral pattern clustering tasks for time series.

item.title: RWEN-TTS: Relation-aware Word Encoding Network for Natural Text-to-Speech Synthesis
item.description: With the advent of deep learning, a huge number of text-to-speech (TTS) models which produce human-like speech have emerged.

item.title: Saved You A Click: Automatically Answering Clickbait Titles
item.description: Often clickbait articles have a title that is phrased as a question or vague teaser that entices the user to click on the link and read the article to find the explanation.

item.title: The Effects of In-domain Corpus Size on pre-training BERT
item.description: Many prior language modeling efforts have shown that pre-training on an in-domain corpus can significantly improve performance on downstream domain-specific NLP tasks.

item.title: Enhanced Training of Query-Based Object Detection via Selective Query Recollection
item.description: This paper investigates a phenomenon where query-based object detectors mispredict at the last decoding stage while predicting correctly at an intermediate stage.

item.title: Image-and-Language Understanding from Pixels Only
item.description: Multimodal models are becoming increasingly effective, in part due to unified components, such as the Transformer architecture.

item.title: Event-based Visual Tracking in Dynamic Environments
item.description: Visual object tracking under challenging conditions of motion and light can be hindered by the capabilities of conventional cameras, prone to producing images with motion blur.

item.title: QueryPose: Sparse Multi-Person Pose Regression via Spatial-Aware Part-Level Query
item.description: The existing end-to-end methods rely on dense representations to preserve the spatial detail and structure for precise keypoint localization.

item.title: FlexiViT: One Model for All Patch Sizes
item.description: Vision Transformers convert images to sequences by slicing them into patches.

item.title: Unsupervised Object Localization: Observing the Background to Discover Objects
item.description: This way, the salient objects emerge as a by-product without any strong assumption on what an object should be.

item.title: Multi-Resolution Online Deterministic Annealing: A Hierarchical and Progressive Learning Architecture
item.description: This simulates an annealing process and defines a robust and interpretable heuristic method to gradually increase the complexity of the learning architecture in a task-agnostic manner, giving emphasis to regions of the data space that are considered more important according to a predefined criterion.

item.title: Non-IID Transfer Learning on Graphs
item.description: To bridge the gap, in this paper, we propose rigorous generalization bounds and algorithms for cross-network transfer learning from a source graph to a target graph.

item.title: DeepLSD: Line Segment Detection and Refinement with Deep Image Gradients
item.description: Their learned counterparts are more repeatable and can handle challenging images, but at the cost of a lower accuracy and a bias towards wireframe lines.

item.title: Localizing Scan Targets from Human Pose for Autonomous Lung Ultrasound Imaging
item.description: Ultrasound is progressing toward becoming an affordable and versatile solution to medical imaging.

item.title: Enhancing Indic Handwritten Text Recognition Using Global Semantic Information
item.description: We use a semantic module in an encoder-decoder framework for extracting global semantic information to recognize the Indic handwritten texts.

item.title: You were saying? - Spoken Language in the V3C Dataset
item.description: This paper presents an analysis of the distribution of spoken language in the V3C video retrieval benchmark dataset based on automatically generated transcripts.

item.title: Put Attention to Temporal Saliency Patterns of Multi-Horizon Time Series
item.description: Motivated by the mentioned observation, in this paper, we propose a novel architecture, Temporal Saliency Detection (TSD), on top of the attention mechanism and apply it to multi-horizon time series prediction.

item.title: ROSCOE: A Suite of Metrics for Scoring Step-by-Step Reasoning
item.description: Large language models show improved downstream task performance when prompted to generate step-by-step reasoning to justify their final answers.

item.title: Efficient Pre-training of Masked Language Model via Concept-based Curriculum Masking
item.description: Masked language modeling (MLM) has been widely used for pre-training effective bidirectional representations, but incurs substantial training costs.

item.title: Constitutional AI: Harmlessness from AI Feedback
item.description: In the RL phase, we sample from the finetuned model, use a model to evaluate which of the two samples is better, and then train a preference model from this dataset of AI preferences.

item.title: BNSynth: Bounded Boolean Functional Synthesis
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a tool BNSynth, that is the first to solve the BFS problem under a given bound on the solution space.

item.title: UnitY: Two-pass Direct Speech-to-speech Translation with Discrete Units
item.description: We enhance the model performance by subword prediction in the first-pass decoder, advanced two-pass decoder architecture design and search strategy, and better training regularization.

item.title: Rethinking Vision Transformers for MobileNet Size and Speed
item.description: With the success of Vision Transformers (ViTs) in computer vision tasks, recent arts try to optimize the performance and complexity of ViTs to enable efficient deployment on mobile devices.
